title: Two Particles on a String

children.value:
Two particles P and Q, of masses 
$\vari{2m}$
 and 
$\vari{m}$
 respectively, are joined by a light inextensible string and rest on a smooth horizontal plane, with the string slack. The particle P is projected in a horizontal direction, directly away from Q, with speed 
$\vari{u}$
.

answer.value:
$\frac{1}{3}$
 of the kinetic energy is lost as the string goes taut.

children.value: Find the loss in kinetic energy when the string becomes taut.
Calculate the impulse (which is equal to the change in momentum) that acts on the particle Q.
